alert.note: Alert for Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; North Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 10:47AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL KNOX...WESTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHWESTERN GRAINGER AND NORTHWESTERN SEVIER COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 PM EDT... At 1147 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Knoxville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Sevierville, Jefferson City, Dandridge, New Market, Strawberry Plains, Blaine, Lake Forest, Mascot, and Piedmont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
